item.author: skels

item.title: Corne / crkbd wireless case with 650mAh battery well
item.description:
This case is a slim version, intended to be used with a nice!nano and a larger battery.
The battery sits underneath the board inside the case.

To assemble you'll need knurls (heatset inserts) to go into the bottom of the case.

Make sure you lay the case flat when you print it.

I printed it in PLA, no supports or anything fancy, its not a very demanding print.
item.author: qubies

item.title: Subaru Outback Keychain/Trinket
item.description:
Subaru Outback Keychain/Trinket

For use as keychain, run chain through the tail or headlights.

Enjoy :)
item.author: NitchMakes

item.title: Dolphin Automaton
item.description:
The goal of this project was to create an automaton, a simple machine driven by cams and a hand crank. In this project, we were asked to create a similar design from inspiration and ideas we found online and then make our own versions, putting it through the design process ourselves.

My project is a dolphin automaton that mimics a smooth swimming motion by moving up and down and this was achieved through the use of cams to push certain parts up and down at certain moments.

Our overall dimensions were 15cm by 6cm by 5cm

*This project is also a partner project and their page is here

item.author: jokisha23

item.title: Ir Pi camera w/ Raspberry pi zero 2 mount
item.description:
I had a small issue with my raspberry pi cable being too short to get a decent angle for my printer, so I made a quick draw-up in Fusion to bind the cases together.

I tweaked the case to fit my pi with a heatsink and an io port

I also added a heatsink to the back of the camera's case as it gets a lot hotter than I had expected.

This is my first published item

item.author: Multihjalle

item.title: Goblin Bomber
item.description:
I recently launched a Patreon and I would like to heart what you guys think. Honestly, it's kind of scary starting from scratch, so if you print this model out, please post a picture so I can see people are out there! What sorts of things do you guys, the makers want? This model in particular is a peek at my upcoming stuff at https://www.patreon.com/3DBreakfast. I'm still testing to see what it is people truly want to print off. You can find My MyMiniFactory page at https://www.myminifactory.com/users/3DBreakfast

You can also join my on discord and talk about it. I would love to hear what you guys think. https://discord.gg/FmP72uFpXg
item.author: 3DBreakfast

item.title: Pere Noel - Fusion 360 CNC Usinage Comment faire - Santa claus CNC Millikng How to do
item.description:
Ce document et cette vidéo pour aider les novices dans fusion 360 pour faire un usinage avec leur CNC sur un père noel.

This document and video is to help dummies to be able to configure in fusion 360 a CNC milling from a flat santa claus picture

https://youtu.be/tOO4F9kG0E0 ( in french, not yet done in english)

performed on lowrider 2 CNC

item.title: Customizable lens hood bayonet generator
item.description:
Fully customizable lens hood bayonet generator for lens hoods with 2 bayonet lugs.

Use this to generate the bayonet and then design your own hood on top of it,
or use the code as a module in your own OpenSCAD script ;)
item.author: OndrejP_SK

item.title: Anet et5 Mounts for biggtreetech skr 1.4
item.description: Mounts for bigtreetech SKR 1.4 Turbo+Mosfet and BTT12864 mini display. This may require extension cables for display, extension for sd card, and for USB plug because original mounts don't let me, place board, to original windows for card and USB. The bottom part for display is designed to screw bolts directly to plastic and mount for board and MOSFET requires M3 thread inserts. This may be suitable for the Fystec display too. !! this printer required changes of cable management to use this board !! (Fan mount for Drivers will be released if I recognize overheating of tmc drivers)
item.author: F-Print

item.title: Ender 3 generic camera rail mount with swivel and arm
item.description:
This is a 4 part camera mount designed to be rail mountable and more generic.

It has a smaller camera mount surface for your webcam's claps to press into.

It needs m5 screws/ nuts.
item.author: nicman23

item.title: Bottom mount 2.5 to 3.5 inch adapter
item.description:
Had an old DVR which only had the holes for 3.5 inch HDD's in which I wanted to place a 2.5 inch hdd.

Made to adapt the 3.5 inch bottom mounting layout to the 2.5 inch bottom layout.

You can use HDD screws in the holes for mounting it. Just press a bit whilst screwing it in to tap some thread.
item.author: verobbert
